I doing some testing creating sessions using New-PSSession with both Windows and Linux. Just discover that I can't use the Disconnect-PSSession cmdlet to terminate my ssh session to my Linux box. 

Steps to reproduce
------------------
1. Create PSSession to Windows and Linux systems:
```powershell
$linuxSession = New-PSSession -HostName lxsys1 -UserName user1
$windowsSession = New-PSSession -ComputerName winsys2 -Credential user1
```

Expected behavior
-----------------
PSSession should have a disconnect state.
```none

```

Actual behavior
---------------
Disconnect error on Linux PSSession.
```none
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.9> Disconnect-PSSession -Session $linuxSession
Disconnect-PSSession : Disconnect-PSSession operation failed for runspace Id = 97a7af76-7509-4274-a796-976fb4324d93
for the following reason: The disconnection operation is not supported on the remote computer. To support
disconnecting, the remote computer must be running Windows PowerShell 3.0 or a later version of Windows PowerShell.
At line:1 char:1
+ Disconnect-PSSession -Session $linuxSession
+ ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
    + CategoryInfo          : InvalidOperation: ([PSSession]SSH3:PSSession) [Disconnect-PSSession], RuntimeException
    + FullyQualifiedErrorId : PSSessionDisconnectFailed,Microsoft.PowerShell.Commands.DisconnectPSSessionCommand

```

Environment data
----------------
Windows 10 Insider Build 17025
<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell
PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.9> $PSVersionTable

PS C:\Program Files\PowerShell\6.0.0-beta.9>

```
![pcoreremoting_04_2017-11-02_10-54-55](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/19892435/32344042-da92395c-bfdb-11e7-9dc0-f990d5c4aaf1.png)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: This is currently expected because WinRM provides the disconnect/reconnect capabilities.  SSHD doesn't do this.  For 6.1.0, we can investigate the cost of doing this, or at least have a better error message.

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
@SteveL-MSFT,

Thanks Steve for the quick response! At least I can use the Remove-PSSession get rid of the Linux session.

In the scenario where you have both a Windows and Linux session, using the the following command will work for Windows and the other fail.
```
Disconnect-PSSession -Session $linuxSession, $windowsSession
```
It would be nice if a resolution could be found.
:)

comments.author: MaximoTrinidad
comments.body:
Hey @SteveL-MSFT 

OK!! It's been a long time and now I notice that the Disconnect-PSSession was dropped from the linux implementation.

I see it very useful when you are doing implicit remoting.  For example, doing an Import-PSSession while I'm already in a remoting session.

I don't want to drop my existing connect but just the one I did the Import-PSsession on.

The example I'm talking about is when working with Office365 while connected to a linux machine.  I only need to disconnect from one session.

Is it possible to bring back the Disconnect-PSSession??
:)

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: @MaximoTrinidad disconnect/reconnect is implemented by WinRM, so it's not trivial to support this on non-Windows.

title: Beta.9 - Disconnect-PSSession not supporting ssh disconnect sessions.
